> Erik Hanson Wrote:

> global_explorer wrote:
>> thanks.  i know there is no guarantee to the order
of
>> processing the test methods, but do they run
simultaneously
>> or serially?  i just have setup data that needs to
be set
>> in the db prior to each one running .. dont want
each test
>> method to step on the others modifications.

>Why don't you just try it and see? It would only take
a few minutes, 
>versus waiting for hours or days for someone to give
you a response 
>here.

I would imagine he's thinking ahead to when he has
many, many tests.  Even then, if/when one fails, it
won't initially be clear if it failed because of a
real bug, or because the tests are stepping on each
other.  And even when you figure that out, it will not
be clear what the right approach is to fixing the
problem with the test.

I've had an issue where tests were stepping on each
other, but we were apparently using a multithreaded
runner.  I used synchronized blocks to fix it up, but
I was constantly having to find and synchronize stuff,
so I'd consider that a cheap hack at best.

Kevin
